faction-overview.content:
SCP FOUNDATION // R.A.I.S.A.

Titan-1 // Alpha Detachment

DOCUMENT REF: SNAPSHOT-2026-24-01
DECLASSIFIED
Unit Overview
Mobile Task Force Titan - 1, designated "Off the Books", is deployed to safeguard VIPs and eliminate hostile groups of interest. They specialize in unconventional warfare, subterfuge, and fear tactics to throw enemies off-balance before raids. Reporting under Director Hollender and the O5 Council.
Focusing in safeguarding anomalous and non-anomalous assets in such ways to keep them controlled under the grasp of the Foundation; not only solely serving as protection, but also as the first line of defense when an asset goes rogue.
Operations are overseen by MTF Alpha-1, designated "Red Right Hand".
Sites of Operations
  • Area 14: PRIMARY DEPLOYMENT ZONE (MAJOR)
  • Area 15: SECONDARY OUTPOST (MINOR)
  • Facility 27: LOGISTICS HUB (MINOR)
  • Site Solara: FORWARD OPERATING BASE (MINOR)
Allied Coalitions
Titan-One maintains strategic partnerships with the following entities:
  • Omega - 72: “Ars Almadel Salomonis”
Command Structure
COMMAND OVERSIGHTS (HIGH COMMAND)
Commander [FL]: Faction Leader. Assigned by Director "████".
Lieutenant Commander [CFL]: Internal & External Affairs. The Right Hand Man.
Colonel [HC]: Operational Security Lead. 3rd in Command.
Lieutenant Colonel [HC]: Disciplinary Officer & Logistics Manager.
Major [HC]: Field Operations Lead.
COMMISSIONED OFFICERS (CO)
Captain [HR]: Primary Field Leader. Training & Discipline.
First Lieutenant [HR]: Executive Officer. Acts in Captain's absence.
Second Lieutenant [HR]: CO/NCO Liaison. Field Discipline Enforcement.
NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS (NCO)
Sergeant Major [MR]: Senior NCO. Minor Leadership duties.
Master Sergeant [MR]: NCO. Assist in squad management.
Sergeant First Class [MR]: Advanced NCO.
Staff Sergeant [MR]: Experienced NCO.
Sergeant [MR]: Standard NCO.
ENLISTED PERSONNEL (LR)
Corporal: Senior Enlisted. Officer Candidate.
Specialist: Advanced Operator. NCO Candidate.
Private First Class: Proven Allegiance.
Private Second Class: Experienced Operator.
Private: Entry Level Operator.
Standard Loadout Manifest
  • Weaponry: ARX-200 Assault Rifle
  • Optics: Quad-Lens Night Vision Goggles (GPNVG-18)
  • Uniform: MCAM
  • Utility: Bodycam / Recording Device (Mandatory)
SECURE COMMS: UPLINK ESTABLISHED [CLICK TO JOIN]

pub-log-002-field-notes.desc: Notes on recent field exercise simulations.
pub-log-002-field-notes.content:
MTF INTEL BRIEFING // PUBLIC RELEASE

Simulation Debrief: Operation Azure Serpent

DATE: 2025-11-15
OPEN SOURCE
Objectives Recap
The simulation focused on rapid extraction of a non-hostile Foundation asset from a highly contaminated urban environment, mimicking a potential Chaos Insurgency breach scenario in Sector Gamma. Primary objective: Zero casualties to the asset.
Performance Metrics
Extraction time was 14 minutes, exceeding the target of 10 minutes due to unexpected secondary resistance points not detailed in initial intelligence packets. Tactical coordination scores were high (92%), indicating strong inter-squad communication.
  • Breaching Speed: +2 minutes variance
  • Asset Securing Time: Nominal
  • Communication Efficiency: 98%
COMMUNITY FORUM: REVIEW FEEDBACK THREAD

pub-log-003-gear-update.desc: Summary of new armor and utility upgrades.
pub-log-003-gear-update.content:
EQUIPMENT ROLLOUT // M-GRADE

New Gen-3 'Aegis' Armor Integration

RELEASE DATE: 2026-02-01
PUBLIC RELEASE
Key Features
The Aegis Gen-3 armor utilizes a lighter composite material, reducing overall operator fatigue by an estimated 12% while maintaining ballistic resistance ratings equivalent to the Gen-2 model. Integrated thermal regulation is a major improvement.
Mandatory Training
All Titan-1 personnel must complete the 'Aegis Familiarization' course by the end of Q1 2026. Failure to do so will result in temporary non-deployment status.
  • Weight Reduction: 2.5 kg
  • Thermal Efficiency: +25%
TRAINING SCHEDULE: ENROLL NOW

pub-log-004-training-schedule.desc: Monthly schedule for non-specialized training exercises.
pub-log-004-training-schedule.content:
TRAINING SCHEDULE // JANUARY

Standard Combat Proficiency Drills

PERIOD: JAN 2026
GENERAL NOTICE
Mandatory Drills - Area 15
All enlisted personnel are required to attend the Bi-Weekly Firearm Proficiency Course (BFPC) at the Area 15 underground range. Officers are strongly encouraged to participate in the Command-Level Simulation Exercises.
  • BFPC Dates: Jan 4, Jan 18 (0900-1400)
  • CLE Dates: Jan 10-12 (Full 72-hour exercise)
Notes on Compliance
Personnel on active deployment or rotation are exempt. Rescheduled drill dates will be provided upon return to base. No exceptions are made for non-exempt status.
DRILL SIGN-UP: ACCESS PORTAL

pub-log-005-site-upgrade.desc: Update on Site Solara infrastructure modernization.
pub-log-005-site-upgrade.content:
FACILITY UPGRADE // INFRASTRUCTURE

Site Solara Power Grid Modernization

REPORT DATE: 2026-01-22
STATUS UPDATE
Project Alpha Completion
The transition to the new Cold Fusion Reactor (Model-CF7) at Site Solara is 95% complete. This upgrade ensures triple redundancy for all primary containment cells and a 40% reduction in external power reliance.
Minor Disruptions
Minor, intermittent power fluctuations may occur in Auxiliary Sector Delta during the final tie-in phase (Jan 25-26). All essential research equipment will be switched to backup capacitor banks for the duration.
  • Completion ETA: 2026-01-27
  • Power Reserve Increase: +200%
ENGINEERING CONTACT: SUBMIT TICKET

pub-log-006-tech-spec.desc: Technical specification for standard communication devices.
pub-log-006-tech-spec.content:
COMMUNICATIONS DATA SHEET // PUBLIC

TR-9 'Whisper' Comms Unit Specs

MODEL: TR-9 Revision 1.1
SPEC SHEET
Operational Parameters
The TR-9 unit provides secure, short-range digital communications utilizing a proprietary frequency-hopping algorithm. Effective operational range is 5 km in high-density urban terrain and 12 km in open-air environments. All units are water-sealed to 50 meters.
Power & Maintenance
Standard battery life is 48 hours under continuous transmit/receive. Users must cycle power every 24 hours to ensure proper re-synchronization of the hopping sequence. Failure to follow this protocol will reduce encryption effectiveness.
  • Encryption Standard: AES-256 (Proprietary Layer)
  • Battery Type: Lithium-Ion Mk. II
TECHNICAL SUPPORT: DEVICE TROUBLESHOOT

pub-log-007-hr-policy.desc: Human Resources update on annual leave policy.
pub-log-007-hr-policy.content:
HUMAN RESOURCES // POLICY UPDATE

Annual Leave Rollover Revision

EFFECTIVE DATE: 2026-03-01
PERSONNEL
New Rollover Limit
Starting March 1st, the maximum number of unused annual leave days that can be rolled over into the next fiscal cycle will be capped at 10 days for all personnel below Major [HC] rank. This encourages necessary psychological decompression.
Action for Personnel
Personnel with a current balance exceeding 10 days are advised to schedule mandatory rest periods before the end of February. Exemptions must be approved directly by Lieutenant Commander [CFL].
  • Carry-over Max: 10 Days
  • Scheduling Deadline: 2026-02-28
LEAVE REQUEST PORTAL: SCHEDULE YOUR TIME OFF

pub-log-008-research-brief.desc: General summary of a non-anomalous research project.
pub-log-008-research-brief.content:
RESEARCH BRIEF // APPLIED SCIENCE

Synthetic Polymer Study: Project 'Adamant'

DATE: 2025-12-10
RESEARCH
Project Goal
Project Adamant seeks to develop a non-anomalous, self-healing polymer for minor breaches in standard containment architecture. Initial trials focus on resistance to high-frequency sonic vibration and mild acid exposure.
Milestones Achieved
Phase I completed successfully, demonstrating an 85% self-repair efficiency over a 12-hour period. Phase II will focus on scaling the polymer thickness to industry standards and temperature variance testing.
  • Healing Rate: 85% (Test A)
  • Next Phase ETA: Q2 2026
RESEARCH DATA: VIEW TEST RESULTS

pub-log-009-community-bulletin.desc: Public notice regarding perimeter maintenance near Area 14.
pub-log-009-community-bulletin.content:
REGIONAL NOTICE // PERIMETER

Area 14 External Maintenance Advisory

ISSUED: 2026-01-25
PUBLIC SAFETY
Scheduled Works
Routine high-tension perimeter fence maintenance is scheduled for the northern quadrant of Area 14. This requires temporary closure of adjacent public footpaths for safety purposes. Drone surveillance will be visibly increased during the works.
Duration & Access
The closure is expected to last 72 hours. All local citizens are advised to use the marked detour route along Route 301. Violators of the exclusion zone will be subject to local law enforcement procedures.
  • Duration: 2026-01-27 to 2026-01-30
  • Affected Zone: Grid N-44 to N-58
LOCAL MAPS: VIEW DETOUR ROUTE

pub-log-010-director-memo.desc: General memo from Director Hollender on performance.
pub-log-010-director-memo.content:
DIRECTOR'S MEMORANDUM // TITAN-1

Q1 Performance Review: Mission Success

DATE: 2026-01-01
MEMORANDUM
Key Performance Indicators
Titan-1's Q1 mission success rate exceeded expectations, logging a 99.4% effective containment or neutralization ratio across all high-risk assignments. The low casualty rate is a testament to superior training and operational discipline.
Looking Ahead
The focus for Q2 will shift to proactive anomaly identification and deep-cover infiltration missions within known Groups of Interest territories. Maintain vigilance and adhere strictly to all new psychological screening protocols.
  • Success Rate: 99.4% (Target: 98.0%)
  • Personnel Casualties: -75% from previous quarter.
DIRECTOR'S OFFICE: SUBMIT FEEDBACK

res-log-004-psy-eval.desc: Post-operation psychological evaluations for MTF personnel.
res-log-004-psy-eval.content:
PSYCHOLOGICAL ASSESSMENT // CLASSIFIED

Titan-1 Post-Incident Review: Op. Echo-9

DATE: 2025-10-22
RESTRICTED
Subject Summaries
Three operators exhibited signs of acute derealization post-exposure to SCP-████'s localized reality distortion field. Standard cognitive therapy protocols were initiated immediately upon extraction.
  • Operator T1-44 (Sgt. R.): High score on the Morality Uncertainty Scale (MUS). Recommend 7-day restricted deployment.
  • Operator T1-19 (PFC K.): Exhibited mild temporal fugue symptoms. Full debriefing postponed until next cycle.
Recommendations
Field therapy sessions should incorporate exposure to lower-level cognitohazards to build resistance. Director Hollender concurs with staggered reintroduction to active duty.
PSYCH REVIEW PORTAL: SECURE ACCESS

res-log-005-goi-intel.desc: Intelligence report on a known G.O.I. operative.
res-log-005-goi-intel.content:
G.O.I. INTELLIGENCE // DEEP COVER

Target Profile: 'The Weaver' (AWC)

INTELLIGENCE DATE: 2026-01-15
RESTRICTED
Operational Summary
'The Weaver' is believed to be an infiltration specialist working for the Analog Watchers (AWC). Known for creating localized informational paradoxes to discredit Foundation field reports. Current location suspected to be within the Sector 7 metropolitan zone.
Tactical Profile
The Weaver displays affinity for low-level probability manipulation. Avoid direct confrontation in areas with high unsecured data flow. Titan-1 engagement protocols emphasize immediate isolation and data purge, not capture.
  • Preferred Alias: Dr. Alistair Finch.
  • Known associates: Zero confirmed links to major hostile G.O.I.s outside of AWC network.
G.O.I. TRACKER DASHBOARD: ENCRYPTED ACCESS

res-log-006-anomalous-sample.desc: Analysis of uncontained anomalous object fragments.
res-log-006-anomalous-sample.content:
BIO-RESEARCH REPORT // HAZARD LEVEL 4

Sample X-77 Analysis: Regenerative Tissue

ANALYSIS DATE: 2026-01-18
RESTRICTED
Fragment Origin
The tissue sample, recovered from the Site Solara perimeter following an unknown projectile impact, exhibits self-repair capabilities far exceeding natural limits. DNA sequencing is inconclusive, showing an unprecedented 18-helix structure.
Containment Notes
Current storage relies on a Cryogenic-Vacuum chamber. Attempts to culture the tissue resulted in rapid localized heat generation and near-breach. Recommend immediate upgrade to Mk. VII Containment Protocols upon full classification.
  • Replication Rate: Doubling every 4.2 seconds (Uncontrolled).
  • Energy Emission: Low-level Gamma Radiation detected during repair.
RESEARCH DIRECTOR: CONTACT BIO-LAB

res-log-007-internal-leak.desc: Internal security report on potential data breach vectors.
res-log-007-internal-leak.content:
INTERNAL SECURITY LOG // VULNERABILITY

Facility 27 Data Exfiltration Analysis

REPORT DATE: 2025-11-04
CLASSIFIED
Vulnerability Identified
An in-depth network audit revealed a dormant exploit in the Facility 27 legacy climate control system, which could be leveraged to siphon low-frequency metadata. This vector was likely created by a deep-cover operative during the 2024 server migration.
Mitigation Steps
Colonel [HC] has ordered the physical isolation of the climate control network from all Foundation intranet lines. A full manual purge of all logged data from the past two years is in progress to ensure no anomalous data remains.
  • Exploit Status: Patched (2025-11-05)
  • Data Loss Estimate: Minimal (Non-critical schematics only).
CYBER-SECURITY COMM: SECURE CHAT LOG

res-log-008-titan-loadout-inventory.desc: Inventory log for specialized containment gear.
res-log-008-titan-loadout-inventory.content:
EQUIPMENT LOG: TITAN-1 ISSUE

Specialized Non-Lethal Loadout Tracker

LAST UPDATED: 2026-01-23
RESTRICTED
Inventory Check
Inventory check confirms all three specialized Chroniton Dampeners are present and calibrated. However, two units of 'Neural Scrambler Mk. IV' are currently unaccounted for after the Area 14 readiness drill.
Discrepancy Follow-Up
Lieutenant Commander CFL initiated a localized search. The missing units were last signed out by Sergeant First Class V. (T1-55). Contact T1-55 immediately for recovery or formal loss report filing.
  • Chroniton Dampeners: 3/3 (Green)
  • Neural Scrambler Mk. IV: 8/10 (Yellow - Search in progress)
  • Kinetic Suppressors: 12/12 (Green)
LOGISTICS MANAGER CONTACT: SECURE COMMS

res-log-009-o5-directive.desc: O5 Directive concerning inter-departmental information sharing.
res-log-009-o5-directive.content:
O5 COUNCIL DIRECTIVE // EYES ONLY

Inter-Departmental Information Segregation

ISSUED: 2025-10-01
TOP SECRET
New Mandate
Effective immediately, all data pertaining to 'Project Chimera' is to be siloed exclusively within the Advanced Research Sector and Titan Command. No cross-referencing with Mobile Task Force deployment logs, including Titan-1's, is authorized without a direct O5-level override.
Titan-1 Implication
Titan-1 personnel are only to receive 'need-to-know' summaries regarding their operational parameters. Any unauthorized inquiry into Project Chimera source code or development milestones will result in immediate reassignment to Class-B amnestic protocols.
  • Directive Level: Absolute.
  • Override Authority: O5-1, O5-7.
O5 DIRECTIVE LOG: SECURE ACCESS PORTAL

res-log-010-weapon-specs.desc: Technical specification for a modified tranquilizer dart.
res-log-010-weapon-specs.content:
ARMAMENT SPECIFICATION // INTERNAL USE

Project 'Silken Hold': Dart Compound 7-Beta

SPEC DATE: 2025-09-01
RESTRICTED
Chemical Profile
Compound 7-Beta is a neurotoxin synthesized using SCP-███'s metabolic byproduct. It induces a non-fatal, reversible catatonic state lasting precisely 180 minutes in subjects within the 70-100kg range.
Delivery System Note
Requires a kinetic velocity of no less than 85 m/s to ensure full penetration of Type-C dermal plating. Standard air-pressure launchers are inadequate; use modified rail system only.
  • Reversal Agent: Antidote Delta-9 (Requires controlled application).
  • Shelf Life (Refrigerated): 3 Standard Years.
PHARMACOLOGY DB: CHEMICAL MATRIX

res-log-011-interception-review.desc: Internal review of communication interception logs.
res-log-011-interception-review.content:
COMMS INTERCEPTION LOG // CODE RED

Analysis of Civilian Network Traffic (Jan 2026)

LOG PERIOD: 01/01 - 01/07/2026
RESTRICTED
Key Communication Vectors
Interception of regional encrypted traffic revealed a sharp increase (55%) in messages containing the phrase 'Bluebird Falls'. This term has no known association with G.O.I. activity but warrants monitoring due to proximity to Area 15.
Titan-1 Relevance
Captain [HR] authorized a low-profile signal trace on five persistent originating IP addresses. No direct threat detected, but anomalous data packet structure suggests proprietary, possibly non-Foundation, encryption algorithms are in use locally.
  • Target IPs: [REDACTED]
  • Encryption Type: Custom Asymmetric Cipher (Analysis pending).
COMMS MONITORING: DECRYPTED TRAFFIC

res-log-012-breach-drill.desc: Drill report on breaching a simulated high-security containment cell.
res-log-012-breach-drill.content:
MTF TRAINING EXERCISE LOG

Cell Breach Simulation - Site 14 Annex

DRILL DATE: 2025-12-18
RESTRICTED
Scenario Parameters
Objective was to breach a reinforced Mk. IV containment cell using non-standard breach charges while maintaining acoustic suppression below 40dB. The cell was simulated to contain a Class-C auditory memetic hazard.
Breach Analysis
Breach charges were effective, but the team exceeded the acoustic threshold by 7dB during the final door detonation sequence, likely due to the stress response of PFC J. (T1-22). Corrective feedback provided on charge placement timing.
  • Total Time to Breach: 4:12 (Target: 4:00)
  • Acoustic Limit Violation: Minor (7dB over)
  • Memetic Containment Failure: Zero (Success)
BREACH PROTOCOL REVIEW: ACCESS AUDIO LOGS

res-log-013-asset-transfer.desc: High-priority transfer log for a high-value asset.
res-log-013-asset-transfer.content:
LOGISTICS MANIFEST // TRANSPORT 77-A

Asset 04-Delta Transfer Log

SCHEDULED: 2026-02-05
CRITICAL
Transfer Details
Asset 04-Delta (Humanoid, Reality-Bending Potential) is scheduled for transfer from Area 14 to the deep storage Vault at Site Solara. Titan-1's role is perimeter defense and escort of the primary transport vehicle (The 'Black Carriage').
Security Protocols
No personnel, including Titan-1 officers, are to make direct visual or vocal contact with the asset. All communication must be relayed through the containment specialist. Deployment of Chroniton Dampeners is mandatory at all three checkpoints.
  • MTF Commander: Colonel [HC]
  • Route: Subterranean Rail Link Gamma (SRL-G).
ROUTE TRACKER: LIVE MONITOR

res-log-014-intelligence-summary.desc: Summary of anomalous activity spikes in Sector 4.
res-log-014-intelligence-summary.content:
MTF INTEL UPDATE // PRIORITY 2

Anomalous Spike Analysis: Sector 4

PERIOD: LAST 48 HOURS
RESTRICTED
Sensor Readings
Area 15's Scansor Array logged 17 discrete, low-power Hume-field fluctuations in Sector 4 over the last 48 hours. Pattern analysis suggests either a highly mobile, low-threat entity or a series of coordinated, minor reality-bending experiments.
Titan-1 Deployment
Major [HC] has deployed two two-man reconnaissance teams (Whiskey-1 and Whiskey-2) for passive monitoring and data correlation. Direct engagement is forbidden. If a Group of Interest is confirmed, Alpha-1 will assume immediate command.
  • Hume Level: 0.7-0.9 standard (Low-level).
  • Team Status: Covert/Passive.
FIELD TEAM STATUS: MAP OVERLAY
